Oh dear, it's a hot, hot desert. You walk aimlessly in the sand, thirsty for water. 

		<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/footstepsInSand_01.mp3'/> In the middle of the hot desert, you found a rusty, old signpost. It has two arrows pointing to the right and the left. However, the letters have faded away.

Upon approaching the general store, you see a boy. He wears a red coat, and he looks very surprised. <break time='0.5s'/><voice name='Justin'> You are a new face here. Do you need help? <break time='0.2s'/> You don't look well.</voice> <break time='0.5s'/> Maybe the little boy has water.

		<voice name='Justin'>

		The boy takes you around the building and enters the store from the backdoor. <break time='0.5s'/> Oh dear. <break time='0.5s'/> It is far from being desirable. It stinks. Smelly, smelly, smelly, it's like wearing the same pair of socks for over a year. <break time='0.5s'/>
		<voice name='Justin'> Yeah. Told you! <break time='0.5s'/> </voice> 
		<break time='0.5s'/> A bald, middle-aged man that looks like in his fifties are slowly walks down the stairs. <voice name='Justin'> Papa! <break time='0.5s'/> </voice> Small pieces of tissue paper are rolled and stuck in his nose. He looks like he could use some more sunshine.

        <voice name='Justin'>

        <voice name='Brian'>

        <voice name='Brian'>

translation.Finding Out.narration:
The father has given you his word that the water is clean for drinking. But even without his promise you'd still chug the whole glass of water, bottoms-up.
        <break time='0.5s'/>
        Ahhhh. Refreshing! Although the water smells a bit off, you don't care. What's important is, you're saved from becoming human beef jerky.
        <voice name='Brian'>
        Feel better? You really looked like the desert's going to get you.</voice> 
        Now it's just the stench that's really
        giving you a headache.
        <break time='0.5s'/>
        <voice name='Brian'>
        Sorry for the bad manners back there. It's just this town has never had a single visitor for a long time. Not after the incident.</voice>
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/actionsounds/as03.mp3'/>You should ask him.

translation.Ask Shopkeeper.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>A while ago the town was famed for our Shawarma. People would come all the way from cities to this dune for a taste of it.<break time='0.5s'/> 

		</voice>
		<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/actionsounds/as03.mp3'/>
translation.Ask for Help.narration:
<voice name='Brian'> 

		<break time='0.5s'/> Anyway, this is a desert so you could imagine it never rains here <break time='0.2s'/> until that night. <break time='0.5s'/> On that night. We've seen the greatest thunderstorm of the town's history, <break time='0.2s'/> but no-one anticipated what came after.</voice>
        <voice name='Justin'>
        <break time='0.8s'/> And then the next morning, my dad started sweating like a cow. So did everyone else. </voice>
        <voice name='Brian'>
        Yeah. <break time='0.5s'/> What's worse was what happens afterward. <break time='0.2s'/>That's right.The stench. This stench. It kept everyone from talking to each other. It drove tourists away. And now, no-one wants to come to our town anymore.</voice>
        <break time='0.5s'/>
        The shopkeeper points to a poster on the left wall. It has some dust and the colors have started to fade away, but it's still pretty clear. 
        <voice name='Brian'>
        The mayor believed that it's a curse from some spell caster. He was trying to find people to help. Even set up a great reward for anyone who lifts the curse. 
        <break time='0.5s'/>
        Since you're here, why don't you help us? <break time='0.2s'/> There's a lucrative treasure, and it could be all yours. In the meantime, you can look around the store. No worries.</voice>
        It seems like they really need your help. Do you want to help them?
translation.Ask for Help.reprompt: It seems like they really need your help.
translation.Ask for Help.recap: It seems like they really need your help. Do you want to help them?

translation.Ask Mayor How He knows.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        A while ago we sent our best people to go and retrieve the stone. When they returned, they were covered in smell even nastier than what we have in the town. But what's worse was that they could barely remember anything. The doctor said that probably the smell was too unbearable that they passed out at some point and lost all the memory. This is all they could remember.</voice>
translation.Ask Mayor The Cave.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        Strangely, some plant roots lead into the cave.</voice>
translation.Ask Mayor The Town.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        The town has a story. I think it's the alchemist who did it.</voice>
translation.Continue Ask Mayor The Town.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        Speaking of which, <break time='0.2s'/> this reminds me of a character, <break time='0.2s'/> yes, quite a character in our town. </voice>
        The mayor pauses to sip a cup of water. He also spreads some of the hot sauce on his nose. 
        <voice name="Joey"> 
        We had this guy who worked in one of the most famous Shawarma places in town. Everything was normal except he sweats a lot, and a lot. It's like he wasn't born for the desert. </voice>
        The hot sauce made the mayor to sweat a little bit, as he tries to wipe of some of them from his cheeks.
        <voice name="Joey">
        But it doesn't just stop there. Oh dear, he has this odor. It was offending the guests. A great embarrassment. </voice>
        The mayor leans back and waves his hands while he talks. 
        <voice name="Joey"> So, in the end, we had to make him leave. That's just a story. I don't know if anyone has hired him again, but that was just some time before this smell found its way into the town. </voice>
translation.Before Leave For the Cave.narration: and you can also heave for the cave.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.Before Leave For the Cave.recap: Well, the options are: A. leave for the cave; B. ask mayor about something else
translation.Leave the Cave.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        I hope that these information are useful to you. We're all looking forward to seeing the town coming back to life some day. Good luck! </voice>
        You leave the mayor's office, back on to the streets. The shopkeeper stands outside.
        <voice name='Brian'>
        are you leaving? bring some of these with you. If you're ready, the horse over there is ready for you; but if you are tired. take some rest. Would you like to leave or take some rest?</voice>
translation.Been Walking For Days.narration:
You've been walking for days, but still no sign of valleys, only desert. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/horseNeighing_01.mp3'/> It's been a couple of days since you left the town. Although having a horse to carry you across the wilderness is fortunate, but now it seems very tired as well. <break time='0.5s'/><audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/smallWind_01.mp3'/> Your vision starts to get blurry again. Strangely, this blurriness seemed a bit, a bit yellow. You tried to muster your consciousness, only to find out that you're heading in to an inevitable sandstorm.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/strongWinds_01.mp3'/> As unwilling as you may be, this is the only way to the Eastern Valleys. You ride into the furious sandstorm. <break time='0.5s'/> 
		
		But soon, the sandstorm has devoured you into the yellow fog. The wind is so strong an unbearable that you couldn't go on anymore. You slowly close your eyes. 
		
		<voice name='Matthew'>
	    Wake up! Wake up! Don't fall asleep! </voice>
	    
	    A faint sound reaches your ear amidst the noise of the storm.
	    
	    <voice name='Matthew'>
	    We're getting out now, so don't fall on me! </voice>
        
        You feel like you were being carried onto a bed, so you close your eyes and let yourself drift away.
translation.Waking Up In An Empty Tent.narration: You wake up finding yourself in a tent. The sunlight sprinkles on your face through the small holes in the ceiling. As you slowly gain consciousness, you hear a strange noise coming from outside.
translation.Details of the Tent.narration: It's a tent with many vials and plants.
translation.Leave the Tent.narration: You're still in the desert. Beside the tent there is a mysterious plant wobbling around, and it's chewing a person. You can also hear someone yelling for help from the plant.
translation.utterance-check if there is anything I c: check if there is anything I can throw
translation.Look Around.narration: You looked around. But found nothing.
translation.Warning to Leave.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        I know why you're here, you need me! Don't leave me in this cowplant. </voice>
        Are you sure you want to leave the man? Maybe we need to help him out.
translation.Examine the Thing.narration: It looks like a cow's head, but it has sharp teeth.
translation.Help the Person.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        Is someone there? <break time='0.2s'/> Thank God! You need to save me from this cowplant. </voice>
translation.MysMan Explains.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        You need to milk the cowplant. </voice>
translation.MysMan Introduces Himself.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        my name is Luke, nothing but a humble merchant in the desert. I sell seeds and plants. I also sell other fascinating little gimmicks that be found nowhere else but in my awesome tent. </voice>
        
        Luke looks at the sun for a bit.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        The sun sure is hot. Let's head back in to the tent first.<break time='0.5s'/> </voice>
    
        You hesitated a little because you still have to find your way to the cave. You still followed him.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Hmm. That wasn't very clever for you to travel through the sandstorm like that. You may have become a part of the desert, you know. </voice>
        
        As he enters the tent, he jumps into the center of tent, like a graceful dancer.
        
        You are inside Luke's tent. There is a giant brown seed on the table beside you.
translation.MysMan Introduces Himself 2.narration: You can ask more about the seed or ask how to get to the cave. You can also thank him and leave.
translation.MysMan Introduces Himself 2.reprompt: You can ask more about the seed or ask how to get to the cave. You can also thank him and leave.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/actionsounds/as03.mp3'/>
translation.MysMan Introduces Himself 2.recap: You walked to the tent with Luke, the seed trader. You can ask more about the seed or ask how to get to the cave. You can also thank him and leave.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/actionsounds/as03.mp3'/>
translation.utterance-tell me more about the seed: tell me more about the seed
translation.utterance-how to get to the cave: how to get to the cave
translation.More About the Seed.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		Ah, yes. This is a seed that makes more seeds. No plant roots, no flowers, just... seeds! I personally use it for seasoning. A great match for all dishes, even junk food. </voice>
translation.MysMan Says Wait.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        Wait, wait, wait! What did I miss? </voice>
translation.Another Item.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        Uh, how about this? This is a plant that glows in the day! </voice>
       
        He takes out a small flower that glows strongly in the tent. 
        
        You can ask more about the flower or ask how to get to the cave. You can also thank him and leave.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/actionsounds/as03.mp3'/>
translation.Another Item.reprompt: You can ask more about the flower or ask how to get to the cave. You can also thank him and leave.
translation.Another Item.recap: Luke took out a plant that glows in the day. You can ask more about the flower or ask how to get to the cave. You can also thank him and leave.
translation.utterance-tell me more about the flower: tell me more about the flower
translation.More About the Glowing Plant.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		Ha! Glad that you've asked. This plant is a tremendous existence in our world. It glows when there's sunlight. If there is no sun, it doesn't glow! Ha! </voice>
		
		You can ask how to get to the cave. You can also thank him and leave.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/actionsounds/as03.mp3'/>
translation.More About the Glowing Plant.reprompt: You can ask how to get to the cave. You can also thank him and leave.
translation.More About the Glowing Plant.recap: You can ask how to get to the cave. You can also thank him and leave.
translation.Next Item.narration:
Strangely, Luke starts to panic. He goes through all of his inventory, again and again. Then, he picks up a glass vial that was immediately in front of him before.
		
		<voice name='Matthew'>
        There! Found you. This, oh my dear, is a rare find out here in the desert. This, is a stinky plant. </voice>
    
        He seems really unsettled, but not because of the plant he's holding up to you. 
        You can ask how to get to the cave. You can also thank him and leave. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/actionsounds/as03.mp3'/>
translation.Next Item.reprompt: You can ask about the plant, ask him how to get to the cave. You can also thank him and leave.
translation.Next Item.recap: Luke shows you a stinky plant. You can ask about the plant, ask him how to get to the cave.  You can also thank him and leave.
translation.MysMan Says Stop.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        Stop! Stop asking me how to get to the cave! Can you not see me trying to avoid your question? How can you be so stupid? </voice>

        As soon as the word stupid comes out of his mouth, he immediately knows that he said something that he shouldn't have.

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        I'm sorry. It's just that I've waited so long for someone to come and ask me about the cave. I'm sorry. </voice>
translation.MysMan Says Stop.reprompt: You should talk to him, probably just tell him, it is alright?
translation.MysMan Says Stop.recap: Luke keeps apologizing to you. You should talk to him, probably just tell him, it is alright?
translation.MysMan Story.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        It all happened a long time ago. Do you know why the town was cursed? </voice>
translation.MysMan Story.reprompt: You can say yes or no.
translation.MysMan Story.recap: Luke asks you if you know that the town is cursed.
translation.MysMan Story Plot 1.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        So you've heard what the townsfolk and the mayor had to say. Well, they never mentioned to you about me, did they? </voice> 
        
        Luke looks away into the holes in the tent.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        They say that it was the alchemist that was responsible for the curse. First of all, it wasn't a curse. It's merely an experiment gone wrong. We were trying to transform the smell of the stinky plant into something enjoyable. But instead, it went wrong. </voice>
        
        Luke picks up the bottle with the stinky plant sealed within, and stares into it.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        The failed potion accidentally went into the soil and contaminated the land. That's how the stench got to everyone.
        
        He sighs and puts down the bottle.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        But that wasn't all. I wasn't thinking properly. I knew that the townsfolk will be angry at us, and I was afraid. I wasn't prepared to take the blame, so I went out and told the townsfolk all about it. I told that it was the alchemist's fault. I thought that would make me feel safer from the anger of these people. </voice>
        
        The wind blows a little bit outside the tent. Luke holds his hands together and covers his face.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        The next thing I know was that when I came back, the alchemist was being yelled at, and banished from the town. 
        
        He breathes sharply, as if he's trying to get himself together.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Well. I left the town soon after. Looking at his old place every day like that, it's just not possible. </voice>
        
        Luke musters his strength and stands up, then look back at you.
translation.MysMan Story Plot 1.recap: Luke tells you that town people blames the alchemist because of an experient that went wrong.
translation.Luke Explains the Cave.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        The cave is guarded by a thick forest. You're probably wondering how a forest could grow in the middle of the desert. Well, the alchemist is an expert in botany. His knowledge allows him to grow anything anywhere, even in the desert. </voice>
        

        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/goingThroughShelves_01.mp3'/>
        Luke goes through his shelf of specimens for a second, and returns with a compass, a small bottle of potion, and a vial of a small, but beautiful flower. Carefully, he uncovers the vial.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Anyways, the forest is a maze. If you make the wrong turn, you'll get lost. This is where the leading flower comes in to play. </voice>
        
        He holds up the flower.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        This flower tells directions. As long as you give it a clear destination, it will lead you to it accurately and timely. Here, hold these two for me, will you? </voice>
        
        Luke then hands over the flower and the compass to you. Suddenly, with an exaggerating pose, Luke throws the potion into the air. But instead, the potion only traveled for a second or two before it landed. The potion breaks. Magically, a garden surrounded by bushes appears in the middle of nothing.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Now. You will use this flower and guide yourself to garden, which is in the center of this maze. First, say to the flower <break time='0.5s'/> "Lead me to the garden." </voice>
translation.Luke Explains the Cave.reprompt: Try to say, lead me to the garden.
translation.Luke Explains the Cave.recap: Luke gives you a magic flower that can lead you. Try to say, lead me to the garden.
translation.MysMan Story Plot 2.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        So you've heard what the townsfolk and the mayor had to say. Well, they never mentioned to you about me, did they? </voice>
        
        Luke away into the holes in the ceiling. 
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        They say that it was the alchemist who was responsible for the incident. And they were right, except for one spot: I was beside him when it took place. </voice>
        
        Luke strokes his chin for a bit.
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        It was merely an accident. We were experimenting with the stinky plant and see if its unbearable smell can become an extraordinary perfume. </voice>
        
        Luke picks up the bottle with the plant sealed in.
        


        <voice name='Matthew'>
        I knew that it was going to fail, but he disagreed. We had a big fight, and I left the lab for the night. The next thing I know, is that the town was flooded with the flower's smell, and the townsfolk were angry at the alchemist. In the end, they drove him away. </voice>

        Luke pauses for a while, as if he was trying to talk to himself in his head.

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        If I had been there to stop him, none of this would've happened. It was my fault. </voice>

        Luke then puts the plant back on the table.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        I know why you're here. You came from the town, didn't you? You're here for the cave, where the alchemist resides. I can tell you about the puzzles in the cave.
translation.MysMan Story Plot 2.recap: Luke tells you that everything comes from an accident.
translation.One Last Thing.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		That's pretty much it. Oh. Wait. </voice>

		Luke goes to a locked chest and retrieves a purple seed.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		There's another thing about the citrine that you're looking for. The antidote cannot be made without this other ingredient. He probably doesn't know this yet, since he has never left the cave. </voice>

		Luke hands the seed to you.
		
		<voice name='Matthew'>
		Here, take it. After all I've done to him, I don't think I'm ready to confront him yet. Bring this seed to him for me. </voice>
		
		Luke walks to the entrance and sticks his head out.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		The day is not young. You must go before the sandstorm comes and catch you again. Or if you want to, you can stay here for a while to wait for the storm to leave. </voice>

		You can pause your journey and take some rest here, or you can continue and hurry to the cave. Would you like to leave for the cave? <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.One Last Thing.reprompt: Luke has handed you a purple seed that is crucial to producing the antidote. Now you may choose to pause your journey and take some rest here, or you may leave and continue to the cave. Would you like to leave for the cave?
translation.One Last Thing.recap: You may choose to pause, or leave and continue to the cave. Would you like to leave for the cave?
translation.End of ACT III, 1&2.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		Very well then. Keep riding to the East. The valley is close. Follow the plant roots and you will reach the cave eventually. </voice>

		Both of you walk slowly outside the tent. It looks like Luke has something to tell you, but he's trying to keep it to himself.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		Hey, </voice>

		As you make yourself comfortable on the saddle, Luke calls you.

		<voice name='Matthew'> 
		When you do meet the alchemist, please tell him I'm sorry. </voice>

		He then gives your horse a big slap. The horse charges into the East, leaving Luke behind in the desert.
translation.End of ACT III, 1&2.recap: Luke asks you to keep going to the east. He also asks you to tell the alchemsit that he is sorry.
translation.MysMan Says Wait I Know.narration:
Just as you're about to leave, Luke grabs your hand and stops you from leaving.

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Wait! Stop! You can't leave. If you leave, you won't make it to the cave. </voice>
        
        He looks at you with determined eyes.

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Yes. I know why you're here. You're here because you need to get to the cave. You're here because you needed the citrine to lift the curse. And I'm the only one who knows how. </voice>

        Do you want to ask Luke why does he know that you are going to the cave?
translation.MysMan Says Wait I Know.reprompt: Do you want to ask Luke why does he know that you are going to the cave?
translation.MysMan Says Wait I Know.recap: Luke stops you as you are about to leave. He says that he knows why you are here. Do you want to ask Luke why does he know that you are going to the cave?
translation.Luke Explains How He Knows.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        When I first met you, you still had that stinky smell that I could recognize anywhere. You came from the West, and there's only one reason for anyone to travel this far in the desert for a cave they've never heard before. I know all of this, because I was a part of the story. </voice>
translation.Luke Explains Plot 3.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        I learned from the townsfolk that the curse was caused by an alchemist. I am also an alchemist, hence all these vials and bottles I carry; but any alchemist would know that a curse is not something that we would do. </voice>
        
        Luke let's go of your hand. 
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Oh, I'm sorry. Anyways, as a fellow alchemist, I've been searching for ingredients that might help alleviate the situation. From time to time I've traveled back to the town and asked for any clues or information about the alchemist. </voice>
        
        Luke then goes through the piles of notes on the ground and retrieves a black little book.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        From the information I gathered regarding the alchemist, the cave and what-not, I think I have a good guess on a challenge that lies in the cave.
translation.Luke Explains Plot 3.reprompt: Luke reveals that he is also an alchemist, volunteered to help with the cause whenever he can. He also knows what challenge is in the cave, which you might want to ask?
translation.Luke Explains Plot 3.recap: Luke looks confused and didn't understand. You might want to ask about the challenge in the cave.
translation.Luke Explains Why He Can't Go plot 3.nar:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        I wanted to go, but I have my own business to look after. Living in the desert is not something particularly easy, you know. On the other hand, you are going, and I can tell you about the challenges, so let's get to it?</voice> <break time='0.5s'/>
translation.One More Thing Plot 3.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        Oh, by the way. </voice>
        
        Luke goes to an old wooden chest and takes out a purple seed.

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        This is what you'll need for the antidote. It's called the Eureka seed. The townsfolk may have told you that the citrine is the key ingredient, but they were only half-right. Only combining the citrine and the Eureka seed can one brew a successful antidote. Take it with you. </voice>
        
        Luke walks to the entrance and sticks his head out.

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        The day is not young. You must go before the sandstorm comes and catch you again. Or if you want to, you can stay here for a while to wait for the storm to leave. </voice>
        
        You can pause your journey and take some rest here, or you can continue and hurry to the cave. Would you like to leave for the cave?
translation.One More Thing Plot 3.reprompt: uke has handed you a purple seed that is crucial to producing the antidote. Now you may choose to pause your journey and take some rest here, or you may leave and continue to the cave. Would you like to leave for the cave?
translation.One More Thing Plot 3.recap: Luke gives you a purple seed called Eureka seed. You may choose to pause, or leave and continue to the cave. Would you like to leave for the cave?
translation.End of ACT III, 3.narration:
<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/horseNeighing_01.mp3'/>
        <voice name='Matthew'>
		Very well then. Keep riding to the East. The valley is close. Follow the plant roots and you will reach the cave eventually. Both of you walk slowly outside the tent. </voice>
		
		It looks like Luke has something to tell you, but he's trying to keep it to himself.
		
		<voice name='Matthew'>
		Hey! </voice>
		
		As you make yourself comfortable on the saddle, Luke calls you.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		If you do meet the alchemist in the end, I would imagine that he demanded the name of this seed. You know, alchemists are all alike, can't trust anything unless they know what it is. Make sure you tell him the name, won't you? </voice>
		
		He then gives your horse a big slap. The horse charges into the East, leaving Luke behind in the desert.
translation.End of ACT III, 3.recap: Luke asks you to say the seed's name when you meet the alchemist. Again, it's called Eureka.
translation.MysMan Spills the Tea.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		Yes, this stinky plant emits a funny and unsettling smell. So unsettling that it can, it can, pollute the water. </voice>



		Luke silences for a long 3 seconds. All you can hear is the wind and the tent flapping in the wind. He doesn't look right. You can ask him what happened.
translation.MysMan Spills the Tea.reprompt: You can ask him what happened.
translation.MysMan Spills the Tea.recap: Luke reluctantly tells you that the stinky plant can pollute water. You can ask him what happened.
translation.Mysman Tells the Story Plot 4.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		It's nothing. </voice>

		Luke smirks a bit.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		Some time ago, a friend of mine was experimenting with this plant. </voice>
		
		Luke points to the vial of stinky plant.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		He believes that he can turn this unpleasant smell into something lovable and out of this world. But he failed, very hard. The scent became so bad that he had to abandon his lab. </voice>
		
		Luke looks to the ground for a bit, then turns away from you.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		That's the last time I heard from him. 


		Before you could ask any questions, he presses on with the conversation.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		You, on the other hand. <break time='0.5s'/> I know what you want. Yes. You want to go to the cave, don't you? Some town in the west needs your help. I've heard travelers here and there trying to get into the cave, and I've seen it myself too. I know that a challenge awaits you in the cave.
translation.Mysman Tells the Story Plot 4.reprompt: Luke tells you that the stinky plant reminded him of a friend who experimented with it, but ended up miserably. Then, he mentions a challenge that awaits you in the cave. You may want to ask him more on that.
translation.Mysman Tells the Story Plot 4.recap: Luke squints his eyes and puts his ears closer to you, like he didn't understand. You might want to ask him more about the challenge?
translation.utterance-why didn't you enter the cave: why didn't you enter the cave
translation.Luke Explains Why He Can't Go plot 4.nar:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        Why I can't go? Well, as you can see how I ended up with that cowplant out there, I'm not the physical type. </voice>
translation.Luke Explains Why He Can't Go plot 4.rec: You should probably ask him what is the challenge.You should probably ask him what is the challenge.
translation.One Last Thing Plot 4.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		Oh, almost forgot. </voice>

		Luke heads under his bed and pulls out an old chest. In it he takes out a vial that contains a purple seed.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		I've been also researching on how to get rid of this mess. It seems like besides the Citrine, you would also need this seed to make the antidote. </voice>
		
		Luke hands over the vial to you.
		
		<voice name='Matthew'>
		This is the Eureka seed. Take it with you. You'll need it. </voice>

		Luke walks to the entrance and sticks his head out.
		
		<voice name='Matthew'>
		The day is not young. You must go before the sandstorm comes and catch you again. Or if you want to, you can stay here for a while to wait for the storm to leave. </voice>

		You can pause your journey and take some rest here, or you can continue and hurry to the cave. Would you like to leave for the cave?

<voice name='Matthew'>
		Very well then. Keep riding to the East. The valley is close. Follow the plant roots and you will reach the cave eventually. </voice>
		
		Both of you walk slowly outside the tent. It looks like Luke has something to tell you, but he's trying to keep it to himself.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		Hey, </voice>

		As you make yourself comfortable on the saddle, Luke calls you.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		Good luck. I hope you find the solution and restore it to its former glory. </voice>

		He then gives your horse a big slap. The horse charges into the East, leaving Luke behind in the desert.

translation.Arrival At The Inner Cave.narration:
You push through the stone doors.

		Immediately, you are greeted with glaring rays of light. 
		Isn't this supposed to be a cave?
		Yes, but none of your assumptions matter. Because right in
		front of you is a hollowed space beneath the earth, filled
		with all kinds of greens and plants. The center of the roof
		is a gigantic hole that allows sunlight to nurture the life
		in here.
		

		
		Suddenly, you hear the tall grass rustling. Something's
		coming towards you.
		

		
		From the bushes, pops out the head of a man with faded purple
		hair. Should you tell him who you are and why you're here?
translation.Arrival At The Inner Cave.reprompt:
You passed the forest maze, into a hollowed space
		underground filled with natural sunlight, and life. Then, a
		man with faded purple hair showed up in your face.
translation.Arrival At The Inner Cave.recap:
The man stood there like a statue. You should try say 
		something to get his attention? maybe just a "hi"?
translation.Alchemist Grabs You.narration:
He stood there and looked at you as you speak. His eyes are
		connected to yours, but you can tell that he's thinking of
		something else.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Um. Here. Please. </voice>

		Alchemist takes your hand suddenly and almost pulls you
		towards a little hut in the cave.
		
		<voice name='Salli'>
		Oh welcome to the cave ok I need to
		work on something please don't come
		out I will be right with you in a
		moment please don't come out ok? </voice>
		
		He puts you in the hut and closes the door.
		


		
		As he closes the door, you hear something filling up and
		tying up the hinges of the door. You try to open it, but it
		didn't work. You're locked inside.
translation.Exit The Room.narration:
<voice name='Salli'>
		Ah! </voice>

		As you finally figured out a way to leave the hut, you see
		the man in your face, but terrified. He takes a few steps
		back, then stumbles on the ground.
		
		<voice name='Salli'>
		Please don't hurt me! I've been trying
		to figure out a way to fix the problem
		I've caused. Wait, you don't look like
		you're from the town. </voice>

		He looks at you for a moment. Then he stands up from the
		ground, getting the dirt off of his clothes. His clothes are
		still dirty, though.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Sorry, it's been a long time since
		I've anyone. My name is Berette, an
		alchemist, and a botanist. I'm working
		on the last step to my latest work,
		care to join? </voice>
translation.Join The Alchemist At the Cauldron.narra:
<voice name='Salli'>
		Wonderful! I'll show you the way to my
		station. </voice>

		Berette leads you to a cauldron set up outside. It's bubbling
		with many stuff that you don't know.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		A long time ago, I did something
		terribly wrong. I've kept myself
		behind these stone doors so I can work
		on a solution to undo my mistakes. I
		think, today is my lucky day. </voice>

		Berette walks to the cauldron.
		
		<voice name='Salli'>
		Alright, ingredients, check. Solvent,
		check. Ok. Let's see if this works. </voice>

		The alchemist walks into the pond in the middle, towards the
		floating citrine in the middle. He takes out a vial and puts
		it under the gemstone.
		

		
		Miraculously, from the gemstone comes out a drop of a glowing
		substance. It's so bright that it could almost be a star in
		the night.
		Berette walks back to the cauldron, and adds in the drop of
		citrine.
		

		
		The pot starts to glow. A golden color emits from the
		cauldron.
		

		
		Suddenly, the contents of the pot explodes into Berette's
		face. Berette slowly finds himself a chair, then sits down
		and cries.

		<voice name='Salli'>

		I don't know! Why? I thought I had all
		of it solved. I was supposed to be
		ready when someone arrives. What
		ingredient am I missing? </voice>
translation.Join The Alchemist At the Cauldron.repro:
Berette extracts a magical substance from the
		citrine in the middle, and adds it into the cauldron he is
		working on. But the content explodes and Berette's experiment
		has failed again. Disappointed and depressed, he asks what
		ingredient he is missing. Perhaps your seed may help?
translation.Join The Alchemist At the Cauldron.recap: Berette asks if he's missing anything in his potion.
translation.Alchemist Asks Again.narration:
<voice name='Salli'>
		Are you sure? I'm pretty confident
		that you're about to see something
		that is beyond your knowledge. </voice>

		Berette looks at you with confident eyes. Perhaps you should
		join him. What say you?
translation.Alchemist Asks Again.recap: You know, you've come this far, why not say yes?
translation.Alchemist Teel You to Stay Here.narratio:
<voice name='Salli'>
        Ah, I see. You are the cautious and
		careful type of person. Got it. Well,
		you just stay here and enjoy the show.</voice>
translation.Alchemist Performs At the Cauldron And F:
Berette walks to the cauldron.
		<voice name='Salli'>
		Alright, ingredients, check. Solvent,
		check. Ok. Let's see if this works. </voice>

		The alchemist walks into the pond in the middle, towards the

		it under the gemstone.
		


		Miraculously, from the gemstone comes out a drop of a glowing
		substance. It's so bright that it could almost be a star in
		the night.
		Berette walks back to the cauldron, and adds in the drop of

		The pot starts to glow. A golden color emits from the
		cauldron.

Berette extracts a magical substance from the
		citrine in the middle, and adds it into the cauldron he is

Berette asks if he's missing anything in his potion.
translation.Alchemist Asks.narration:
You gave the seed to the alchemist. The alchemist looks at it
		for a second, then stares at you with wide-opened eyes.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Who gave you this seed? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Asks.reprompt:
You gave the purple seed you have to Berette. He
		now asks who gave you the seed.
translation.Alchemist Asks.recap:
You gave the purple seed you have to Berette. He now
		asks who gave you the seed.
translation.Alchemist Questions About Luke.narration:
<voice name='Salli'>
		What? Luke gave you this seed? Luke
		<break time='0.5s'/> gave <break time='0.5s'/> you <break time='0.5s'/> this
		<break time='0.5s'/> seed? Oh, now he knows how to
		be an apprentice. To not stab his
		master in the back? Did he tell you
		what happened? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Questions About Luke.reprompt:
You told Barette that it was Luke who gave you the
		seed, and he seemed to be very angry. He asks you if Luke
		told you what happened.
translation.Alchemist Questions About Luke.recap:
<voice name='Salli'>
		What? Is that a yes or a no? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Continues to Scold Luke.narrat:
<voice name='Salli'> 
        So you knew all of it, right?
		Unbelievable. I thought we were
		partners and friends. And what did he
		do when the incident broke out? He
		went straight to the mayor and turned
		me in. </voice>

		Barette walks around the room. You can almost see steam
		gushing out of his nose.
		
		<voice name='Salli'> 
		Alright, what else did he say?</voice>
translation.Alchemist Asks What Luke Says Again.narr:
Barette looks astonished, as if he couldn't believe what he
		has heard.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		What? Say that again? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Scolds Luke Thrice.narration:
Barette seems disappointed and furious.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		This mandrake, well he ought to give
		it to me. </voice>

		Barette looks at you. He realizes that you may not understand
		something. He holds up the seed to you.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		This, my friend, is a Glimmerbrook
		Mandrake. You don't find this
		anywhere. It is basically impossible
		to get, like the citrine. If Luke
		managed to find this, well, he doesn't
		deserve it anyway. So I guess he made
		the right choice of giving it to you. </voice>

		Barette suddenly realizes something.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Hmm. Given that this is hard to come
		by anywhere, perhaps we can try to add
		this into our mix? Come on, let's see
		what happens. </voice>
translation.Alchemist Scolds Luke For His Weird Beha:
<voice name='Salli'>
		That's weird. Never thought Luke would
		say anything like that. Huh. anyways,
		he's not my apprentice anymore, and I
		deserve this Mandrake. </voice>

		Barette looks at you for a second, then he realizes
		something.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Oh, yes. This seed, it's called the
		Glimmerbrook Mandrake. You don't come
		across this plant like you breathe
		air. It's basically as precious as the
		citrine. Not of this world. Magical.
		Judging by its rarity, and the fact
		that Luke gave you this, it's probably
		worth a shot. </voice>

		Barette stops writing and closes his notebook swiftly

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Today, I will go home. I will end this
		mess once and for all. </voice>
translation.Alchemist Sits Down.narration:
<voice name='Salli'>
		Oh. </voice>

		Barette slowly moves to his hut, and looks at a photo on the
		wall. It is a photo of him and Luke in the lab, except the
		cauldron was on fire.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		After all this time, huh? </voice>
		
		Barette lets out a short sigh.
		
		<voice name='Salli'>
		You know, you we used to be partners.
		Luke and I. Together, we've
		accomplished many things that no
		alchemist or botanist has ever done.
		He was a dear friend. </voice>

		Barette then smiles a bit. He looks down on the ground.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		We used to shout out Eureka! To each
		other. That was the phrase we use when
		we did something together. </voice>

		Barette then realizes that he went off by himself.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		You said this seed was from him? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Accepts.narration:
<voice name='Salli'>
		Oh pal. How long have I waited for
		you. </voice>

		Then he turns around and looks at the seed.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		If Luke gave you this, and knows that
		you're coming for me, then this has to
		be the key ingredient that I'm
		missing. Come, let's finish this once
		and for all. </voice>
translation.Alchemist Smirks And Accepts.narration:
<voice name='Salli'>
		Ha. Very much like what he would do.
		He would deny everything until you
		corner him, even when he did nothing
		wrong. </voice>

		Then he looks at the seed in his hand.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		If Luke gave you this precious plant,
		knowing that you'll end up meeting me
		eventually, then he probably knows.
		This plant must be the key ingredient
		that's missing. Come, let's finish
		this once and for all. </voice>
translation.None of It Matters Anyway.narration:
<voice name='Salli'>
		Huh. Can't say that I'm surprised by
		now. Took me so long to realize what
		kind of person he is. </voice>

		Barette walks swiftly to his notebook by the table, with the
		seed in his hand. He talks to you while he puts down notes in
		his book.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Luke was my apprentice. Or should've
		been. The night the when the
		experiment went wrong, he left and
		turned my name in to the mayor. I
		mean, I admit, I messed it up, but was
		that really necessary? </voice>

		Barette then stops for a moment as he continues to scribble.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		None of it matters anyway now. What
		else did he say? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Questions About the Seed.narra:
Barette seems very, very amazed.
		
		<voice name='Salli'>
		Wow. Do you even know what this seed
		is? It's a miracle that you come
		across it. It's called the
		Glimmerbrook Mandrake. You don't just
		find it here, or anywhere. Frankly,
		you can't find it in this world.
		Anyways, this person you meet, must be
		a great botanist, or a great magician,
		or both. </voice>

		He takes another careful look at the seed. Suddenly, he jumps
		up and looks at you with shining eyes.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Given the rarity of this plant... this
		could be the key ingredient to our
		potion. Come on, this could be our
		only chance to set things right. </voice>
translation.Alchemist Asks More.narration:
You gave the seed to the alchemist. The alchemist looks at it
		for a second, then looks at you with confused but trembling
		eyes.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		What? This is called Eureka? Who told
		you that it's called Eureka? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Asks More.reprompt:
You gave the Eureka seed you have to Berette. He
		now asks who told you that the seed is called Eureka.
translation.Alchemist Asks More.recap:
You gave the Eureka seed you have to Berette. He now
		asks who told you that the seed is called Eureka.
translation.Alchemist Realizes.narration:
<voice name='Salli'>
		Oh. </voice>

		The alchemist pauses for a second. Then he slowly walks back
		to the hut.
		

		
		He looks at a photo on the wall. It's a photo of him with
		Luke when the cauldron in front of him explodes.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Oh. Partner. Why don't you just come
		to me directly? It's been so long. </voice>
		
		Barette looks at you. He then smiles.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		That man you just met outside the
		tent, well, he's officially known as
		an apprentice to me. But I see him as
		my partner. </voice>

		Barette then hols up the Eureka seed to you.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		This is not called Eureka. This, is a
		Glimmerbrook Mandrake. Eureka is a
		word we use back in the day to
		celebrate the progress we made. Dumb
		old friend, I'm not angry at him
		anymore. </voice>

		Barette sits there quietly.
		
		<voice name='Salli'>
		This plant. you don't just come across
		it here. Or anywhere. It's just as
		hard to find as the citrine is. If he
		gave this plant to you, and didn't ask
		for anything in return, this could
		only mean that it's the ingredient
		we're missing. </voice>

		Barette then extend his hands to you.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		C'mon, pull me up. Let's get this
		potion finished, and end this crisis
		once and for all.
translation.Alchemist Realizes.reprompt:
Barette realized something as soon as you told him
		who named the plant Eureka. It turns out that Luke was
		Barette's lab partner before, and the word Eureka is a word
		that only the two would use before; no matter what happened
		before, Barette is not angry with Luke anymore. Now, with the
		seed, Barette is ready to use the seed and end the stinky
		curse once and for all. He extends his arm and asks you to
		pull him up from the chair.
translation.Alchemist Realizes.recap: You should pull him up from the chair.
translation.Alchemist Smirks.narration:
The Alchemist exhales deeply. He then looks at you with a
		smirk on his face.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		This is not called Eureka, my friend.
		This, is a Glimmerbrook Mandrake. </voice>

		Barette then looks up into the sky, and talks slowly.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		You know, back in the day the word
		Eureka meant something to me. It's
		just a silly phrase that me and my old
		friend use all the time. Haven't seen
		him for a long time. </voice>
		
		Barette walks back to his hut.
		


		He looks at a photo on the wall. It's a photo of him and
		Luke, taken when the cauldron in front of him explodes.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		We had a big fight one night over
		procedures of a certain experiment.
		Turned out he was right. I was too
		eager and too confident. After that
		night, the water and the soil of the
		town are all contaminated. </voice>

		Barette looks down on the ground, then you.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		That's why I fled away. I couldn't
		dare face the anger of the
		townspeople. I hid myself within these
		caves, and I told myself that I'd
		never come out until I figure out a
		solution. </voice>

		He holds up the mandrake seed, and smiles at it.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Well, this could be our lucky day.
		Let's see if this works, shall we?
		Pull me up from this chair. </voice>

		He extends his arm out and asks you to pull him up.
translation.Alchemist Smirks.reprompt:
Barette realized something as soon as you told him
		who named the plant Eureka. It turns out that Luke was
		Barette's lab partner before, and the word Eureka is a word
		that only the two would use before; no matter what happened
		before, Barette is not angry with Luke anymore. Now, with the
		seed, Barette is ready to use the seed and end the stinky
		curse once and for all. He extends his arm and asks you to
		pull him up from the chair.
translation.Alchemist Smirks.recap: You should pull him up from the chair.
translation.utterance-pull him up from the chair: pull him up from the chair
translation.Alchemist Brews Potion.narration:
Barette quickly walks back to the cauldron. He extracts
		another drop of substance the citrine releases.
		After adding all the regular ingredients, there is one thing
		left to do: add the mandrake seed. 

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Here goes nothing. </voice>

		He allows the seed to slip and roll of his palm. The seed
		slowly falls and enters the pot.
		

		
		Poof! Smoke emerges from the pot. Strangely, you see sparkles
		of purple within the fog. It swiftly rises and fills the roof
		.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Huh. This is unlike anything I've
		seen. Oh dear.</voice>

		In just a few seconds, the fog gathers into clouds above
		their heads.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		What was that?</voice>

		Barette suddenly asks. You felt the same thing. Water.
		

		
		The cave starts pouring rain. But it was no ordinary rain.
		The raindrops that are supposed to hit your harshly, instead
		felt like cool splashes of spring water.
		As you look to Barette, you noticed something else: he no
		longer smells.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		The smell. It's gone. We did it! We
		did it, visitor! We've found the
		solution!</voice>

		Barette holds his hand tightly, and punches into the sky.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Eureka!</voice>

		Then he hugs you tightly, and dances around, as if joy is an
		emotion new to him.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Quick! Pack your stuff immediately. We
		will end this chaos once and for all.</voice>



		As you close in on the town, you could smell that stench
		again.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Don't worry guys, I'm here to correct
		everything.</voice>

		A woman in the town shouts.
		
		 <voice name="Kimberly">
		Look! It's the alchemist!</voice>



		The town bell rang. Although they'd prefer not to, the
		townspeople all came out to check what's going on.

		<voice name="Joey">
		Look who's back here, villain. Did you
		return only to give us yet another
		curse?</voice>

		<voice name='Salli'>
		No! People. I came back here because I
		knew I did something terrible. I came
		back because I've found a way to fix
		all of this.</voice>

		 <voice name="Kimberly">
		Oh, is that so? How do you propose to
		fix this disaster?</voice>

		<voice name='Salli'>
		By this!</voice>

		Barette takes out the vial containing the purple potion.

		<voice name='Brian'>
		No! Not one of your tricks again,
		wizard! We don't trust you.</voice>

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Please! You must believe me.</voice>

		 <voice name="Kimberly">
		Get out of here.</voice>

		The crowd boos at Barette, chanting for his immediate
		banishment. The mayor seemed a little bit hesitant.
		Barette looks at you. He gives you the vial.

		<voice name='Salli'>
		Open the vial. Show them that they're
		wrong.</voice>

		Will you open the vial?
translation.Open the Vial.narration:
You opened the vial without hesitation. Smoke glittering
		purple comes out of the bottle, and into the sky. In no time,
		the blue sky is filled with purple clouds.
		As expected, it starts raining. The stench starts to wear
		away.
translation.Dont Open the Vial.narration:
You stood there and do nothing.
		
		<voice name="Joey">
		I'm sorry, Barette, but I think, we've
		seen what you're capable of. You even
		turned our visitor against us. You
		must leave. </voice>

		 <voice name="Kimberly">
		Leave! Leave! Leave!</voice>
		
		<voice name='Brian'>
		Leave! Leave! Leave!</voice>
		
		<voice name='Justin'>
		Wait!</voice>

		The shopkeeper's son yells at the crowd.

		<voice name='Justin'>
		I believe him.</voice>

		Slowly, he walks towards you, and takes over the potion.

		<voice name='Brian'>
		Boy, what are you doing?</voice>

		<voice name='Justin'>
		Fixing all of you.</voice>

		In a blink of an eye, the boy opens the vial. Smoke
		glittering purple comes out of the bottle, and into the sky.
		In no time, the blue sky is filled with purple clouds.
		As expected, it starts raining. The stench starts to wear
		away.
translation.After Opening the Vial.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>
		Wa, what? What's going on?</voice>

		 <voice name="Kimberly">
		Is my nose going crazy?</voice>

		<voice name="Joey">
		No.. it's the stench. It's getting
		washed away! Everyone! Come outside!
		The rain is washing away the stench!</voice>

		People started to come outside of their heavily-locked
		houses. No people like them has ever enjoyed the rain so
		much.
		By the time the rain ends, the stench is completely washed
		away. The town is saved.

		<voice name="Joey">
		I'm sorry, Barette. It's just that
		we've been so scared and desperate
		about it. We are grateful for you
		coming back.</voice>

		 <voice name="Kimberly">
		Hum. Had he not done those weird
		experiments, this would never have
		happened in the first place.</voice>

		<voice name='Brian'>
		Come on, Chilirosa. It's all over. </voice>
translation.Luke Returns.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
		There's someone arriving from the
		East! </voice>

		The soaked townspeople looked in to the East. A figure
		approaches the town on a camel. You squint your eyes as the
		visitor's shape reminds you of someone.
		It's Luke.
		The alchemist looks to the East as well. Then, he starts to
		walk towards Luke in big strides; Luke gets off the camel and
		walks in big strides as well. The two collided with each
		other into a big hug.
		They are too far for you to listen to what they're saying,
		but from the looks on their faces, you are sure that it's
		something worth celebrating.
		
		<voice name="Joey">
		Well, Let's discuss
		about the reward I promised, shall we? </voice>

		<voice name='Brian'>
		Wait, this is a perfect photo moment,
		isn't it? Everybody gather around.</voice>

		As you try to find your spot in the crowd, the mayor grabs
		you upfront.

		<voice name="Joey">
		No, my friend. You deserve to be at
		the very front.</voice>

		You sit firmly on the ground. Everyone is happy. As if spring
		and life is coming back to the desert.

		<voice name='Brian'>
		3, 2, 1, say cheese! </voice>
translation.Luke Watches From the Distance.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
		Well, Let's discuss
		about the reward I promised, shall we? </voice>

		<voice name='Brian'>
		Wait, this is a perfect photo moment,
		isn't it? Everybody gather around.</voice>

		As you try to find your spot in the crowd, the mayor grabs
		you upfront.

		<voice name="Joey">
		No, my friend. You deserve to be at
		the very front.</voice>
		
		<voice name='Salli'>
		Oh. How I wish Luke was here.</voice>

		You sit firmly on the ground. Everyone is happy. As if spring
		and life is coming back to the desert.
		You spot someone in the distance. You could almost tell who
		the person is by the outline, but soon the figure turns
		around and leaves the town.

		<voice name='Brian'>
		3, 2, 1, say cheese!</voice>
translation.Luke Is Nowhere To Be Found.narration:
<voice name="Joey"> 
		Well. Let's discuss 
		about the reward I promised, shall we? </voice> 
 
		<voice name='Brian'> 
		Wait, this is a perfect photo moment, 
		isn't it? Everybody gather around. </voice> 
 
		As you try to find your spot in the crowd, the mayor grabs 
		you upfront. 
 
		<voice name="Joey"> 
		No, my friend. You deserve to be at 
		the very front. </voice> 
 
		<voice name='Brian'>

translation.cowplant_puzzle_start.narration:
You wake up finding yourself in a tent. The sunlight sprinkles on your face through the small holes in the ceiling. 
		As you slowly gain consciousness, you hear a strange shouting coming from outside.
		<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/manscream_01.mp3'/> 
		But before you get the sound, it's strange enough that you ended up in this tent. What's inside this tent? you should look around.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_around_tutorial.nar:
Surprisingly, it's a fairly large tent, and a messy one. Books and papers are scattered everywhere on the floor. 
		There is also a cabinet full of plants and seeds and mysterious materials contained in vials and glass jars. 
		A leather book that reads Cowplant Observation Notes is present on the small table beside it. That's pretty much it in the tent.  
		And then you hear another sound. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/cowplantThrowOut.mp3'/> What's outside?
translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_around_tutorial.rep: You hear another sound. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/cowplantThrowOut.mp3'/> What's outside?You should go outside.
As you exit the tent, you see the familiar, infinite desert. 
		Oh. You're still in the desert. As you look back at the tent, you immediately noticed a strange plant. 
		This plant is the size of a big refrigerator, and it has a mouth. That's right, a mouth. 
		A man is lying on the ground, fainted.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_interaction.repr: You can look around, look at specific things. or go to the tent. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>

translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_whatdo.narration: You can look around, look at specific things, go outside.

translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_view_tent.narrat: You look at the tent. That's the tent you came from. You can go to the tent at anytime.

translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_view_door.narration: You look at the door. It leads to outside. You can go outside as you want.

You pick up the notebook. It is heavy. Dozens of bookmarks are stuck on different pages. You take the notebook with you. 
		So, at anytime, you can look at the note book to see more details.

translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_view_notebook.recap: You should pick up the notebook first.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_view_man.narration: You look at the man. He is sitting in front of the table. Looking at nowhere. His eyes are out of focus. You should ask what happened. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/actionsounds/as03.mp3'/>
translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_view_man_talk.narra: He is muttering no sense words. You probably need to figure out what happened to him by yourself. And hopefully you can find how to cure him. Possiblly from the notebook?

translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_around_man.narratio:
You are in a messy tent. A man is sitting in front of a  small table. A leather book that reads Cowplant Observation Notes is present on it. 
		Behind you, it's the door.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_stereo_on.narrat:
You turn on the stereo. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/Act3+puzzle/radio.mp3'/> 
		Oh, my, god. The plant is swagging along the music.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_view_stereo.narr:
You look at the stereo. It is placed on the ground beside the plant. Looks like someone listens to it frequently.
 You can turn on the stereo.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_view_basket.narr: You look at the basket of swordfish on the corner. It seems like someone is feeding this creature by swordfish. You can probably interact with the plant, to feed it.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_cowplant_interaction.rep: You can do anything to the cowplant, or you can leave the plant.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_cowplant_interaction.rec: You can not do that to the plant. If you don't know what to do to it, you should probably leave the plant right now and come back later when you can think of what to do.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_view_plant.narra:
You look at the plant. It is a bizarre plant.  
		It has a cow head but roots of plants. A bell is hanging on its stem, or, you should say, neck. 
		Staring closer at the plant, a tinny label is taped on, reads, cow-plant. It is waving as it is attracting your attention. 
		It sticks out its tongue to you, and the weirdest thing is, the tongue is a cake! 
		You can do anything to the cowplant by saying, go to the plant.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_wake_man.narrati: You wake up the man. He stares at you for a second and walks straight to the tent. He is muttering some nosense words. You wonder if he is the one who saved you from the sandstorm, and what damaged his mind. You can probably go to the tent to discover more, or you can look at other things.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_view_man.narrati: You look at the man. He is fainted, and lying on the ground. He is wet and smelly. Some sort of liquid sticks on all of his body. You can wake up the man.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_around_man.narra: You look around. You are outside. Looking at far away, you can only see the infinite desert. In front of you, there is a tent, and a plant. A man is lying on the ground. Besides the plant, there is a basket of swordfish, and a stereo.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_around_noman.nar: You look around. You are outside. Looking at far away, you can only see the infinite desert. In front of you, there is a tent, and a plant. Besides the plant, there is a basket of swordfish, and a stereo.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_getmilk.narration: You go to the tent. The man is still stumbled. You forced him to drink the milk. <voice name='Matthew'>Ahhh... What is that! en... Thanks. You bring me back!</voice>
translation.cowplant_puzzle_plant_milk.narration: You milk the plant, <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/milkingCowplant.mp3'/> and get a bottle of potion. That's it! That is the potion which can heal the man.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_plant_cake.narration: You go for the cake but then you find that grabing its cake tongue is too disgusting to do.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_plant_play.narration: You play with the cowplant.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/cowHappy.mp3'/> It seems happy.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_plant_feed.narration: You picked up a swordfish from the basket and feed the plant with it. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act3/cowplantSounds_01.mp3'/>
translation.cowplant_puzzle_grab_notebook.narration:
You look at the notebook. You wonder what cowplant is. 
		So, you find the bookmark that reads, Introduction, and you flip the notebook to that page. 
		It reads. Cowplant is a bizarre, partly bovine form of vegetation. It usually has 4 growth states. 
		You can search for any keyword that you found from the previous pages. For example, try to search, growth states.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader.repr:
What keyword do you want to search? You can search for any keyword that you found from the previous pages. 
		Or you can close the notebook if you are finish searching.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_intr:
You searched the keyword, cowplant introduction, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. 
		Cowplant is a bizarre, partly bovine form of vegetation. It usually has 4 growth states.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_devo: You searched the keyword, devour, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. If a person attempts to take the cake again, the cowplant will devour them. Which means, they are killed forever.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_deme: You searched the keyword, severe dementia, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. Allergic to cowplant can possiblly cause severe dementia to certain people. Syptoms include eyes out of focus, memery lost, and loss of ability to speak. Drinking the cowplant milk will release the bad mood, as the same time, cure the allergic symtoms.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_alle: You searched the keyword, allergic symtoms, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. A few people are allergic to be swallowed by the cowplant. Allergic symtoms are different from person to person. Possiblly causing severe dementia to certain people.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_spro:
You searched the keyword, sprout, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads.
 When you plant a Cowplant Berry, there are tiny horns appearing through the soil.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_berr: You searched the keyword, cowplant berry, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. Cowplant berry is a black and white berry. Once you plant the cowplant berry into the soil, it will gow up as a sprout stage cowplant.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_hung:
You searched the keyword, hungry, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads.
When cowplant is hungry, it will stick its cake tongue out. You can feed them at this moment. Cowplant will swallow whoever go for the cake.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_deat: You searched the keyword, death state, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. Twelve hours after a Cowplant shows its cake tongue, and is not fed, it will die, A dead Cowplant has a dead stem with a hanging Cowplant skull. Cowplants cannot be saved after this stage.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_milk: You searched the keyword, milk, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. If people were swallowed for the first time, the cowplant will produce milk. Milking a cowplant, you will get a potion to release the mood, and give the emotions back to the patient. The study found, drinking the milk can also cure the allergic symptoms.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_swal:
You search the bookmark that writes, swallow, and opened up from that page. It reads.
When a person is swallowed for the first time, the Cowplant will spit them out, and they will recieve a drained mood, which will last two days. The mood
will make people feels like an emotionless shell. Different allergic symptoms causing by swallowed have been found to a few people. If attempt to go for the cake again, the cowplant will devour them. But, if people survive from the first swallowing, the cowplant will produce milk.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_cake: You searched the keyword, cake tongue, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. Cowplant has a cake shaped tongue. When it is hungry, it will stick its tongue out to attract people's attention, so cowplant can swallow them.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_feed: You searched the keyword, feed, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. A Cowplant can  be fed  by meat when its hungry and its cake- shape- tongue sticks out.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_stat: You searched the keyword, growth states, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. Cowplants usually have three growth states, and can die. They are sprout state, baby state, mature state, and death state.

You searched the keyword, growth states, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. 
		It reads. Cowplants usually have three growth states, and can die. They are sprout state, baby state, mature state, and death state. 
		To finish searching, try close the notebook.
Try close the notebook.To finish searching, you should close the notebook.

You should try to close the notebook right now. 
		If you can think of any keyword that you want to search, you can look at the notebook again, at anytime.To finish searching, you should close the notebook.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_matu: You searched the keyword, mature state, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. In this stage, the Cowplant is fully matured. You can feed it, or at certain moment, you can milk it.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_baby: You searched the keyword, baby state, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. A few days after you plant the cowplant berry. You can see a tiny cowplant. In this state, you can't do much things with it.
translation.escape_puzzle_intro.narration: What should you do? Probably look around?
translation.escape_puzzle_intro.reprompt: You have arrived at the cave, only to be locked in a small hut by a man with faded purple hair. The door seems to be stuck by something, so you're trapped inside. What should you do to get out?

translation.escape_puzzle_around.narration:
You looked around the small hut. The door is obviously locked. In front of you, there is a table with some stuff stacked on top. Beside the table, you see a trash bin. Right across
 		the table, there is a flower stand. On your right, there is a strange equipment that looks like a portal. And on your left, you see a chest. You can look at 
		different things to see more details.

translation.escape_puzzle_view_door.narration: You look at the door. It has been locked from outside.
translation.escape_puzzle_view_wand.narration: You look at the wand. It's a wooden wand. Nothing else special.
translation.escape_puzzle_view_wand_no.narration: You look at the wand. It's still in the metal box. If you want to look into details, you should find a way to break the metal.
translation.escape_puzzle_insert_wrong.narration: You tried to insert it into the portal, but it doesn't fit.
translation.escape_puzzle_insert_note.narration: You insert the notebook into the portal. It obviously doesn’t go there.
translation.escape_puzzle_insert_metalbox.narration: You insert the metal box into the portal. It doesn’t seem to fit in the hole. But what about the wand inside?
translation.escape_puzzle_freeze_lamp.narration: You want to freeze the alcohol burner, but putting an alcohol burner into ice water will either do nothing or damage it.
translation.escape_puzzle_heat_barrel.narration: You heat up the barrel. But a little alcohol burner will do nothing to a large barrel of ice water.
translation.escape_puzzle_heat_note.narration: You want to heat up the notebook, but then you realize that it will set the notebook on fire. It probably isn't a good idea to set the house on fire.
translation.escape_puzzle_freeze_note.narration: It's probably not a good idea to freeze someone's notebook. You'll probably destroy it.
translation.escape_puzzle_damage_wand.narration: You already got the wand out of the metal box. Either heating up the wand or freezing the wand will damage it. Don't do that.
translation.escape_puzzle_insert_wand.narration: You insert the wand into the portal. It fits into the hole perfectly. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act5/magicSound01.mp3'/> The inscriptions around the portal start to glow.
translation.escape_puzzle_stand_portal_ready.narrati: You stand on the portal. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act5/magicSound03.mp3'/> The wand is reacting to the dirt in your hand.

translation.escape_puzzle_stand_portal_ready.recap: You can say, teleport, or you can step back.
translation.escape_puzzle_stand_portal_out.narration: You are traveling through the portal.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act5/Act+5+puzzle/portaltravel_01.mp3'/> In a blink of an eye, you are standing in the inner cave. You made your way out!
translation.escape_puzzle_stand_portal_realm.narrati: You are traveling through the portal. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/Act5/Act+5+puzzle/portaltravel_01.mp3'/> After a short time, you appear in a different space. You are on top of a floating island.
